関連科目: Career seminar for international organizations, Internship in UN and Diplomatic Institutions
授業の概要・背景: This Course will review managerial dimensions of international organizations from various perspectives including mandate; governance mechanisms; the secretariat; strategy and programme development; budget formulation and resource mobilization; latest topics such as evaluation of organizational effectiveness, transparency and accountability. The course will be taught by senior UN and other international practitioners and experts, so that students will be able to learn the latest and practical issues surrounding management of international organizations.

Relationship and the modality of collaboration with member states in the context of country support will be discussed. Experiences of policy responses to rapid fertility decline in Bhutan and other countries at the United Nations Population Fund will be employed as case studies. Roles of expertise within and outside the United Nations system will particularly be discussed.
